text:
Handy CSS Tip:
If you use the HubSpot Icon field it creates an SVG which defaults to black
If you want it to be the same colour as your text use:
fill: currentColor; on the svg
currentColor is the text color (which get’s inherited by default)
Thanks Stefen... FYI we wound up foregoing the custom message for LI, as we could not find a feasible workaround
We have a major redesign coming up... we'd love to start with a new portal if possible, then "flip the switch" when it's ready. Is that possible to switch production portals?
did you try using the `|urlencode` filter?
Hey, is there way to make meta description a required field on webpages?

Site Search
Is there a way to exclude global site elements from the site search?
We have a global footer / navigation that we are trying to exclude from the site search.  Thank you!
Yeah, I was able to get the parameters in there correctly, but LI is stripping them out... they dont allow anything but the URL to be passed in as of late 2019.

Hi Chris, this is a frequent pain point for us too. We've gone down the script option a few times but, like you, sometimes it's not a great solution. Would love HS to simplify this one!

If we come up with an easy solution we'll let you know!
you can put the class `hs-search-hidden` on the html element and it won’t be indexed
